abilitygroupdescription.p: Theurgic magic is magic channelled from a powerful deity. They involve the use of the characters magic pool and are only available to certain archetypes.

abilitydescription.p: If successful those observing the character will be struck by their holiness and devoutness. This will grant a +Rank bonus to Negotiate actions or Charm spells against good creatures.
Demons must make an Mettle Check DDC:5+Rank to resist or become Enraged and Charge the caster.
Undead monsters must make a Willpower DC 15 check or become Enraged and Charge the caster.

Augury involves petitioning a deity or powerful being for information or insight. Auguries are performed by interpretation of the stars, palmistry, tea leaf reading, dream interpretation, use of cards, the entrails of a sacrificial victim etc. The character should choose one method per message deity and use that method thereafter.
The augury process follows the following steps. First, the character asks a question, then they prepare the augury, and finally they examine the auspicies for the answer.

When asking the question it is important that the augure specify to whom they are directing their question otherwise nameless eavesdroppers may respond. Asking the question is usually done in one of the old languages. Firstly because it may be easier to communicate to the entity in that language, and second because it makes for good theatre.

The steps to prepare an augury depend on the method of divination, but could include making a cup of tea, or sacrificing someone on an alter. The Gods are more likely to answer the character if a method appropriate to the God is used.

Finally, the auspices can be examined. The GM will answer the characters question in a three words or less or provide no response. If the augury is unsuccessful those words may have nothing to do with the question being asked. The check is made as an hidden opposed check modified by how likely it is for the god to know the answer and the likelihood that the god cares enough to answer. At higher ranks the character may be gifted visions as a response.
It is important to know that in Malleus Deum the Gods are capricious, are not omniscient or in general, particularly caring. So they may not answer the characters augury.

A character may keep making checks and asking questions until they fail, at which point they feel they have lost the attention of the god and no more attempts may be made to contact that deity for next day.

ability.abilitytitle: Back! Thou Creature From the Abyss

abilitydescription.p: The character calls on their deity to repel demons. Demons must make a DC 9 Mettle Check the first time they come within a radius of 3+Rank meters10'+Rank×3'. Many demons will avoid making this check.

abilitycheck.effect: weapons receive +Rank dmg vs demons and undead

abilitydescription.p: Renders all weapons so blessed as magical for the next ten minutes (granting them the magic tag). Grants +Rank damage for these weapons against demons and the undead during that time. In the event of overcharge the weapons will glow with radiant light. The spell effects Rank+1 weapons that can be seen by the caster.

abilitycheck.effect: Alies make defensive checks against evil opponents.

abilitydescription.p: The caster calls on Mithras to protect the faithful. Allies gain +Rank to defensive checks against evil creatures.

The character has about his person some number of vials of holy water they had created earlier for just such an occasion. When required the caster makes a magic check. If successful they are carrying 2+Rank vials of holy water, otherwise they are only carrying one vial. Note that the character must have a long rest before they can make this check again. Holy water takes time to prepare so the caster cannot produce a never ending stream of holy water vials. To cast this spell the deity that cleric follows cannot be evil. Also note that the character must have access to vials and water to create holy water. They cannot produce water in the desert.
Holy Water can be prepared before it is needed. In this case Rank+1d4 vials are created. Holy water should be kept in a special font. If kept in a vial it lasts a few days.
When struck the character may check and if successful make an immediate counter-attack. On overcharge the character is Enraged.
The character can cast this spell to purge evil spirits from a possessed person or a location such as a burial site, or demon temple.

When purifying a person or an area the difficulty of the check is determined by the GM based on how evil the site is. This works as follows: first the character commits, but does not roll, at least three dice to the purification, then the GM reveals the difficulty of the check to the player, at this point the caster may choose to add additional dice to their check. Then the character rolls the magic check as usual.

Provides a +Rank bonus to Near-Death saves. If the character recovers hit points as a result of their Near Death rolls they gain an additional +Rank hit points. While stop a corpse from turning to undeath if cast early enough.
If called upon Mithras will grant a +Rank bonus to the caster to hit rolls and damage.

abilitycheck.effect: arrow or bolt misses or is rerolled

abilitydescription.p: This spell can be used offensively or defensively.
In defence, after a missle is fired, hits and the damage is rolled, the caster, predicting the outcome of the shot, uses his powers to deflect the missile instead so that it now misses.
In offence, after a missle is fired and it would have missed. The caster uses his powers to try to guide a missile to its target. The shot is rerolled.
This spell does not work on bullets, which fly so fast the character has no time to react.

The healing character places their hands on a bloodied target and makes a check. If successful the bloodied character heals 2d4+Rank Hit Points. On overcharge the healer accidentaly uses their own animus in order to heal the bloodied character and loses d6 hitpoints.

The character gazes into the eyes of their target and makes an opposed Mettle check against them. If successful the target is mesmerized and will perform as the character dictates. Mesmerized characters will not perform actions that result in self-harm. Good characters will not harm others if mesmerized. This effect lasts for as many rounds as the difference between the casters roll and the targets roll.
The character creates a bright divine light attached to some object. The light burns for an hour. It is as bright as a pitch torch.

Once per day the caster may attempt the Litany of Redemption. This is a five minute ritual where the caster quotes passages from the Book of Light and reflects on the lessons within. If successful participants refresh a single mettle die if able.

The character implores their patron to take them in the stead of some other individual Near Death. If the character succeeds, up to 2d6 Health (or the targets maximum health whichever is smaller) is added to the targets health and removed from the casters Health. In the event of an overcharge the caster loses any remaining health and is Near Death themselves.

The character can casts this spell to purify food or water that has gone rancid, rotten, is poisoned, or is brackish. The caster can purify enough food for three people for a day per rank of the spell. Most deities will not take kindly to being continuously hassled because a follower cannot be bothered to organize provisions. In such cases the caster may lose favour with their god.

Theurgy is the study of how to cast theological, or clerical, spells. There is a separate ability called Theology that represents study of the the deities, the history of religion, and of the teleolical origins of the world. In most cases both abilities are required to cast theurgic spells.

If successfully cast, the caster gains +2xRank to attack checks and +2xRank to damage with attacks made using a hammer or mace for the rest of the combat. These bonuses do not stack with other magical bonuses the caster has for those attacks.

The character calls on their deity to repel beings animated by necrotic forces. Successfully casting this spell will cause the undead to make a DC Mettle check greater with a DC of 7+Rank. If they fail this roll they must not come any closer to the caster than they currently are. If the caster moves towards them they must retreat. On overcharge the caster is transfixed by the spell, and unable to move for its duration. The caster may end the spell at any time after the turn they cast the spell. This spell will work on any number of the same type of undead at one time.

The character calls on their deity to repel beings animated by necrotic forces. Successfully casting this spell will cause the undead to make a DC Mettle check greater with a DC of 7+Rank. If they fail this roll they must retreat from the caster. They will not return for some time. On overcharge the caster is transfixed by the spell, and unable to move for its duration. The caster may end the spell at any time after the turn they cast the spell. This spell will work on any number of the same type of undead at one time.

The character calls on their deity to repel beings animated by necrotic forces. Successfully casting this spell will cause the undead to make a DC Mettle check greater with a DC of 7+Rank. If they fail this roll they are destroyed. On overcharge the caster is transfixed by the spell, and unable to move for its duration. The caster may end the spell at any time after the turn they cast the spell. This spell will work on any number of the same type of undead at one time.

abilitycheck.effect: Make three melee attacks if Health≤6

abilitydescription.p: The character calls on their patron for support in the hour of their death! If the characters health is 6 or less they can use the Witness Me! ability to make three melee attacks in that round instead of their usual standard action.
